message: Anyone got any good resources or tips on designing an SQL database.
it depends on what you want to build, and make class to handle all database handling since you don't want a lot of openings to your database it will slow it down
I found that drawing or using an ORM helps visualize and organize a system

I whiteboard everything for my database before I begin building it. It really helps me understand how all the data is going to work together. I've always found that having a solid plan in place before you even start building any tables helps me avoid a lot of headaches later on down the road.

If you understand how to normalize a database, the design sort of come easily.
ORM helps a lot. MySQLWorkbench is great at doing those
don't forget the indexes! till you have few records is not a problem... but when you start to have a massive load of datas... are more then important
I just use a pen and paper.
pen+paper and after MySQLWorkbench or directly Sequel Pro
whiteboard and then mysql in terminal.
